metadata.Description: Geothermal energy is heat derived within the sub-surface of the earth. It is a renewable source of energy that can be used for heating, cooling, and electricity generation.

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Geothermal energy is heat derived within the sub-surface of the earth. It is a renewable source of energy that can be used for heating, cooling, and electricity generation.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
A concept that aims to ensure a fair and equitable transition to a sustainable energy system, taking into account social, economic, and environmental aspects.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.

relations.Description: Geothermal energy implements Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.
relations.Subject: geothermal energy

relations.Description: Geothermal energy funds Research and Development to explore new technologies and improve efficiency.
relations.Subject: geothermal energy

relations.Description: Geothermal energy focuses on Renewable Energy Sources to reduce reliance on fossil fuels.
relations.Subject: geothermal energy

relations.Description: Geothermal energy is included in the Energy Transition Strategy to achieve a sustainable energy mix.
relations.Subject: geothermal energy

relations.Description: Geothermal energy partners with Local Communities to ensure their involvement and support in sustainable energy projects.
relations.Subject: geothermal energy

relations.Description: Geothermal energy contributes to Climate Change Mitigation by reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
relations.Subject: geothermal energy

relations.Description: Geothermal energy monitors Energy Production to optimize efficiency and ensure sustainable operations.
relations.Subject: geothermal energy

relations.Description: Geothermal energy targets increased Renewable Energy Capacity to meet sustainable energy goals.

energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition collaborates with local communities to ensure a fair and inclusive transition to sustainable energy.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition supports energy equity by promoting equal access to clean and affordable energy.

relations.Subject: energy storage
relations.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: renewable energy certificates
relations.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

Geothermal power plants are a sub-component of geothermal energy. They harness the heat from the Earth's core to generate electricity. This process involves drilling wells into geothermal reservoirs and using the steam or hot water to drive turbines.
relations.Subject: geothermal power plants

relations.Description: Geothermal heat pumps are a type of geothermal energy technology used for heating and cooling buildings. They utilize the constant temperature of the Earth to transfer heat from the ground to buildings in winter and vice versa in summer.
relations.Subject: geothermal heat pumps

relations.Description: Geothermal reservoirs are underground areas where hot water or steam is trapped. They are essential for the extraction of geothermal energy as they provide the source of heat that can be harnessed for various applications.
relations.Subject: geothermal reservoirs

relations.Description: Geothermal drilling is the process of creating boreholes in the Earth's crust to access geothermal reservoirs. It involves specialized drilling techniques and equipment to reach the desired depth and extract the geothermal resources.
relations.Subject: geothermal drilling

relations.Description: Geothermal energy exploration is the process of identifying and assessing potential geothermal resources. It involves geological surveys, data analysis, and exploration drilling to determine the viability and capacity of geothermal energy production in a specific area.
relations.Subject: geothermal energy exploration
